topic.title: boot.zeronet.io: What is it?
topic.body:
Today noticed this when starting Zeronet: Peer:boot.zeronet.io
What is it for? Is it needed to work?
Isn't it risk when zeronet connects there at startup or is connection secure over TOR if set "TOR=always"?

topic.title: IFS2.0 with BFS (needs testing)
topic.body:
IFS Intergalactic File Server has a revised interface and integrated BFS (Big File Support) via its clusters:
You can help test it here and give feedback:
http://127.0.0.1:43110/12MVkvYGcRW6u2NYbpfwVad1oQeyG4s9Er

topic.title: How does content started under non-tor ZN peer ever get spread to TOR-ZN peers?
topic.body: Arent those two networks distinctively exclusive?

topic.title: Zeronet and DPI (Deep Packet Inspection)
topic.body: Is it possible to filter/block ZN traffic via DPI https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Deep_packet_inspection ?

topic.title: ZeroVoat: Help test topics with added files
topic.body:
In "Test Channel", please add topics with "add file" to see if it works, e.g. like this topic:
http://127.0.0.1:43110/1J1c7eML6uMwDU4uiKbKRxoqxGP6WMFMvb/index.html?v=topic+id=1DnmGgRaHo2puhutf6Dn4MjF4eXmqmdLZ1topic6

Thanks for help testing and making ZV better and better!
If you have any idea, please add comment.

topic.title: IFS Help seed testing new frontend
topic.body:
not much different to see yet, but start using a cdn system, so we need a few peers to help seed the frontend page and some hubs:
http://127.0.0.1:43110/1CLm2ET29VWxF2utb1uzhziBco3fFnnygT

topic.title: New Zite Backup Feature
topic.body:
New backup feature is awesome, wanted to say thanks!

For all who havent seen it: One can easily now backup a complete zite from the right sidebar option:
Download as .zip

It autogenerates a zip with zite name and date as backup filename.

topic.title: Someone able to load this zite?
topic.body:
It probably just needs more seeds for main and merged zites:
http://127.0.0.1:43110/1KMyW1NdcHzBNPSfc5z5gMdDdg3nLUiWic/
http://127.0.0.1:43110/1E5AsNLcgXpKvMghMhBt5MUubeDLiyz1og/

This is for supposedly archiving links to ZN, but seems to miss layout/style and media to transfer to ZN.

1_1Mr36Z4TSbWQ236NfvRPeLn3qsAwngBzMd.body:
prototype reddit like site for possible discussions:
127.0.0.1:43110/1J1c7eML6uMwDU4uiKbKRxoqxGP6WMFMvb
it is similar to reddit, but decentralized and built up by people.
It is using moderation possibility for various reasons, but not total censorship possible (one could clone and unhide channels or add their own channels if one is too strict moderated).
It is pre-alpha, so some things not working 100%, also needs possible split into merger sites for huge growth, customizing channels, etc.
suggestions welcome.

16_13Z7XxTa7JuFat3KzzMWu3onwM6biLuurJ.body: we know about the cert issues, but on holiday this week (back on monday :)

> [bot](#comment_202_1KdnTJVBGzEZrJppFZtzfG9chukuMv8xSb): The entries are back. It helps to get good feedback, instead of the "boo-hoo i'm leaving" type. ThxOur zite list is a problem i'm working on. I'm trying to update to 0.5.4. It works locally, but shows blank elsewhere.

Great to hear!

1_1Kr2JfCsBYQU1z96xQsYTshKvJ5nz4mTG3.body:
> [skwerlman](#comment_15_1JupR9ExhM4aiVd1Jyy2iuS12eukDnQ54X): Why not use IPFS? It'd reduce a lot of the duplication of effort...

because it needs well integration:
2x different systems setup + Making sure one system like IPFS doesnt sabotage the other ZN, e.g. one goes through anonymizer and the other dont, etc.
Otherwise its like saying "why not add flash or activex to normal html website?": because its not useful.

3_1JTtwMPZ5mKaF6S1wAPzZ8SmZTgTygz5Rb.body:
> [zerolee](#comment_4_1JTtwMPZ5mKaF6S1wAPzZ8SmZTgTygz5Rb): Zeronet will always be free to use, but users can have the option to earn cryptocurrency, also a payment option for premium services and tools.

"Always free to use" and "payment for premuim services and tools" in one sentence, lol.
Thats exactly why ETH, etc. imo is crap. It just turbo-capitlizes things and thereby even more disfavors those who cant afford to keep up the rats race.

Just noting:
The main reason against any electron or chromium-based ideas related to zeronet is that both code bases are mainly from google. Read more about the concerns from tor-developers and why they favor firefox-only.

1511531379_1R67TfYzNkCnh89EFfGmXn5LMb4hX.body:
> [zazing](#comment_5_1AZYSfyeKjZbAN9BPYYFf1FCSm9ujLXMcu): I think the 404 err comes up when the browser tries to play the video but nothing was downloaded yet, because zeronet is still searching for peers or downloading the 1st piece of it.

So after second try you could watch the full video?

Its embedded from ZN directly, not proxy or Clearnet.
Its done via shared content on clusters of the same type: CDN.
So lije imgr or youtube content inside reddit, we can built ZN-only cross-zites.

1511662798_1PdVrw7boKHUavWTQxD3UaNGM4tx5.body:
> [ghostofthepast](#comment_1_1LtFqzCrfXwPYCHH6HJUs8Pv9Zit67iKYw): Ive been depressed and jobless for years. I cant feel anything but numbness. The world is so pointless to me. Its hard to even move around and stand. Im so weak i worry about my health. Suicide is something i think about hourly. Im different than other people. I wasn't meant for this world.

You're a part of this, we're all here for some reason, even if infinite small, that's the only thing that counts.
As the quote from the movie "Brazil": "We're all in it together." YOU being here gives others hope!

1518467842_1BGWexcsjvPpnPZVmmioZvwBBQ3Wo.body:
> [bloodchen](#comment_1_1HtLUrLSr2Px9PowoSFhAacNpxdDh1YTBp): ...as long as the owner are OK with it.
The whole implementation of ZN is that everybody already has a copy of whatever is accessed, no need to get permission of "the owner".

1522347695_1R67TfYzNkCnh89EFfGmXn5LMb4hX.body:
> [ssdifnskdjfnsdjk](#comment_202_1L4dZcDF2maSKHDy788yhxpYnBWnXadUtS): I tried and i think it works well, at least i see the images. Though i no longer can see buttons for edit/delete of the topic. Comment has edit button, no delete button.

I see your image, thanks for testing!

Edit:
There should be an "edit" button for both your own Topics and Comments, mainly in the overview or if you click on your ID in the upper right corner of the header, though no more "Delete", as one can still "Edit" and completely empty their content, but without affecting others responses.

1522338314_1CDsYvuQP8StQGAMEgWVZuztHTsXP.body:
> [ssdifnskdjfnsdjk](#comment_200_1L4dZcDF2maSKHDy788yhxpYnBWnXadUtS): Zeronet has Tor "Available" and "Enable Tor for every connection" modes. Maybe second one will ensure even clearnet zite elements are loaded via Tor even i am not using Tor browser? I am wrong?

I think that is wrong, second option "Tor always" only makes sure all ZN traffic is routed through TOR.
If ZN zites contain or embed clearnet links or media, i think it will not route these through TOR if you use a normal browser and not a TOR Browser.

One way would be for a non-TOR bowser to not allow any other traffic than :43110 to be loaded/accessed by using proxy settings, so anything outside of ZN simply doesnt render at all.

Anyone please confirm or correct this assessment.

i mean if all trackers gets blocked 100% by GFW... wouldnt then all 1,000,000 chinese users cut from any more ZN updates? Or is there another method that ZN can use to make ZN unblockable?

1525777374_1R67TfYzNkCnh89EFfGmXn5LMb4hX.body:
This feature allows for easy offline storing backups in case something goes wrong with a zite.
So the backup is conserved and never updated / corrupted, as opposed when you possibly wake up one morning and see something happened to one of your loved zites overnight :)

One suggestion to improve this would be to put this option also in the dropdown menu for each zite in the frontpage bookmarks sidebar, so you have "Delete" and "Backup".
just use the update function, it will get you a more recent rev version.

> [thunder33345](#comment_33_1AHEQxyRG9s6owyJHShB4U4rg9GL5FMX5K): you meant the one on the zerohello?yep it dosent... it still say rev 3465 as up to date

try updating anyway, it always says latest version, when there is already a newer rev.

1530191313_16NS3rBdW9zpLmLSQoD8nLTtNVsRF.body:
Zeronet Blocklists could be implemented like Adblock Filterlists:


Anyone can freely decide to subscribe to any list or combination of lists that fit his/her viewing habit.
Of course you always do trust those who put together these lists, like with adblocklists on the clearnet.
But since like with adblock filters nothing gets really deleted (just blocked like ads), and those lists would be transparent, people would quickly find out if any list either doesnt effectively block said content or starts blocking more than the wanted type of content.

Think of lists like "no spam", "no cp" and "no NSFW", but also more exotic stuff like "nothing trump" blocklist or "no taylor swift" if someone simply doesnt like to be bothered by that kind of stuff. :)

Like adblocker lists, these lists should be globally manageable and be able to target individual content like bigfiles, images, videos, or any kind of textinput by certain users.
This would ensure that even if zites whose owners dont bother, have become inactive or simply cannot cope timewise with submissions on their zites can be safe-guarded, very much like adblockers can prevent any type of content from getting loaded and showing up on a local machine.

This should also prevent stuff from getting accidently loaded in the background, even if no person has consiouscly viewed or rendered that content yet.

Such a way of moderating content could turn out be very effective and even be an essential pre-requisite for other "normies" to start surfing decentralized networks, as everything on such networks is basically every first click can be a click into the unkown.

The big question is:
How can a group of people start working together on such a list by looking out and identifying and reporting content of a certain type, without at the same time allowing abuse by other people who might report false positives to undermine such an effort?

One way could be the owner/moderator of any list gets all content that is flagged towards that list presented in a neat way somewhere to review and then decide if valid that content is added to that list or rejected and then simply ignored.

That way such lists could evolve, much like Adblock lists evolved over time.

The "good thing" is, it is much like what some governments do with State wide lists, only that in this case, the people themselves govern such lists in a non-enforcing and transparent way.
